page.title: 03Poultry Farm
page.content: Catbrook Poultry Farm has 8O,OOO laying hens. They start laying when they are about 22 weeks old and are kept until they reach 76 weeks old. The hens consume about 48 tonnes of layers ration a week. Up to 45O,OOO eggs are produced by this type of farming in one week. The farm has employment for 3 full-time stockmen and ten part-time egg collectors. The eggs are collected and sent to Monmouth for packing. They are graded and distributed to the shops. All the cracked and soft-shelled eggs are cracked out and mashed up into a melange, frozen and sent to London to be pasteurised and used by cake manufacturers. The manure from the hens is collected by local farmers and used as a general fertilizer.
